dcterms:creator: J. Grammig
A. Heinen
E. W. Rengifo
dcterms:description: The XETRA Order Book Data consists of all recorded order book events of the XETRA system for trading of the 30 stocks that constituted the German stock market index, DAX between January 2 and March 26, 2004. The data allow for the full recovery of the order book and cover order arrivals, (partial) matches, changes, and cancellations.
dcterms:title: XETRA Order Book Data

dcterms:creator: Z. Bi
C. Faloutsos
F. Korn
dcterms:description: The DGX Distribution is used for modeling order arrivals and cancellations in the limit order book. It is particularly useful for capturing the heavy-tailed nature of order sizes and arrival rates.
dcterms:title: DGX Distribution

dcterms:creator: B. Biais
P. Hillion
C. Spatt
dcterms:description: The Limit Order Book Events dataset provides empirical data on the limit order book and the order flow in the Paris bourse, which is used to analyze market dynamics.
dcterms:title: Limit Order Book Events

dcterms:creator: J.-P. Bouchaud
M. MÃ©zard
M. Potters
dcterms:description: The Order Size Distribution dataset provides empirical results and models related to the statistical properties of stock order books, focusing on order sizes and their distributions.
dcterms:title: Order Size Distribution

dcterms:creator: R. Cont
S. Stoikov
R. Talreja
dcterms:description: The Market Impact Data provides a stochastic model for order book dynamics, which is used to analyze the impact of orders on market prices.
dcterms:title: Market Impact Data
